name: Navratri
title: Nine Nights of the Goddess - Durga Puja
description: Navratri is a nine-day festival dedicated to the worship of Goddess Durga and her nine divine forms (Navadurga). It celebrates the divine feminine power and the victory of good over evil.
significance: Honors the nine forms of Goddess Durga and celebrates her victory over the buffalo demon Mahishasura.

seo.description: Complete guide to Navratri festival with Garba, Dandiya, rituals, stories, bhajans, and celebrations. Learn the significance of Nine Nights of Goddess.

sections.title: Welcome to Navratri
sections.content: Navratri, meaning 'nine nights', is one of the most significant Hindu festivals dedicated to Goddess Durga. This festival celebrates the divine feminine power and the victory of good over evil.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: Navratri has been celebrated for centuries and finds mention in ancient Hindu texts. The festival commemorates the victory of Goddess Durga over the buffalo demon Mahishasura, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil.

sections.title: Famous Stories
sections.content: Navratri is associated with powerful stories of Goddess Durga and her various forms.

subsections.title: Mahishasura and Durga
subsections.content: The central story of Navratri is the battle between Goddess Durga and the powerful demon Mahishasura. He had been granted a boon that he could not be killed by any man or god. To defeat him, the gods combined their divine powers to create Goddess Durga, who fought Mahishasura for nine days and nights.

subsections.title: The Nine Forms of Durga
subsections.content: During Navratri, nine different forms of Goddess Durga are worshipped: Shailaputri, Brahmacharini, Chandraghanta, Kushmanda, Skandamata, Katyayani, Kalaratri, Mahagauri, and Siddhidatri.

sections.title: How Navratri is Celebrated
sections.content: Navratri celebrations include fasting, dancing, and elaborate rituals.

subsections.title: Garba and Dandiya
subsections.content: In Gujarat and other parts of India, people perform Garba and Dandiya Raas dances. These are traditional folk dances performed in circles with colorful costumes and music.

subsections.title: Fasting and Prayers
subsections.content: Many devotees observe fasts during Navratri, consuming only specific foods. They perform daily prayers and worship different forms of Goddess Durga each day.

sections.title: Rituals and Pooja
sections.content: Navratri rituals include elaborate pooja ceremonies and traditional practices.

subsections.title: Kalash Sthapana
subsections.content: The festival begins with Kalash Sthapana, where a pot (kalash) is installed and worshipped as a symbol of the universe and divine energy.

subsections.title: Daily Pooja
subsections.content: Each day, a specific form of Goddess Durga is worshipped with flowers, fruits, and special offerings. Devotees chant mantras and perform aarti.

sections.title: Navratri Special Foods
sections.content: Special fasting foods are prepared during Navratri.

subsections.title: Fasting Foods
subsections.content: Popular Navratri fasting foods include Sabudana Khichdi, Kuttu Ki Puri, Singhade Ka Halwa, and fruits. These foods are prepared without onion and garlic.

subsections.title: Traditional Sweets
subsections.content: Special sweets like Malpua, Kheer, and Coconut Laddu are prepared as offerings to Goddess Durga.

sections.title: Navratri Bhajans
sections.content: Devotional songs sung during Navratri to honor Goddess Durga.

subsections.title: Hey Ma Durge
subsections.english:
O Mother Durga, giver of happiness
Who is our support without you
Mother of the world, star of the world
subsections.meaning: This bhajan honors Goddess Durga as the supreme divine mother and protector.

sections.title: Navratri Aartis
sections.content: Traditional aartis performed during Navratri celebrations.

subsections.title: Jai Ambe Gauri
subsections.english:
Jai Ambe Gauri, Mother Jai Shyama Gauri
Day and night meditate on you, Hari Brahma and Shiva
subsections.meaning: This is the traditional aarti of Goddess Durga, describing her divine beauty and attributes.
